snippet: High-resolution images of the Athabasca Valles near the Martian equator reveal coiling spiral patterns that closely resemble lava flows on the Big Island of Hawaii.
abstract: Andrew J Ryan study in journal Science suggests that a group of valleys near the Martian equator known as Athabasca Valles were not formed by ice, as some scientists have theorized, but more likely were formed by lava flows.
lead_paragraph: High-resolution images of the Athabasca Valles near the Martian equator reveal coiling spiral patterns that closely resemble lava flows on the Big Island of Hawaii.

headline.print_headline: Signs of Volcanoes In Mars Topography
headline.seo: Volcanic Activity Played Role in Mars’ Valleys, Study Suggests
headline.main: Signs of Volcanoes In Mars Topography
